snippet: “American Odyssey: Photos From the Detroit Photographic Company, 1888-1924,” which opens with a sampling of New York vistas, contains color photochroms, as they were called, that the authors say were “the first color photographs of the North...
abstract: Book American Odyssey: Photos From the Detroit Photographic Company, 1888-1924, assembled by Marc Walter and Sabine Arque, presents color images known as photochroms, said to be first color photographs of North American continent; book opens with a bountiful sampling of New York vistas, most of them scenes of downtown.
lead_paragraph: “American Odyssey: Photos From the Detroit Photographic Company, 1888-1924,” which opens with a sampling of New York vistas, contains color photochroms, as they were called, that the authors say were “the first color photographs of the North American continent.”
